DataElement.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Maximum Severity Index Grade
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Grade to signify the overall intensity of liver, gastrointestinal, and skin signs and symptoms in a person with acute Graft versus Host Disease (GVHD).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Maximum Grade
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._The largest possible quantity or degree._A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A graft versus host disease with symptoms appearing within the first 100 days post-transplant, but with short duration.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Property.preferredDefinition: The largest possible quantity or degree.:A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

Concepts.definition: The largest possible quantity or degree.
A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Severity Index Grade
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness._Index; a numerical scale used to compare variables with one another or with some reference number._A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Grade D = Skin stage 4 or Liver stage 4 or GI stage 4

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Grade D = Skin stage 4 or Liver stage 4 or GI stage 4
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Grade D severity is composed of three components: Skin stage 4 or Liver stage 4 or GI stage 4

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Grade C = Skin stage 3 or Liver stage 3 or GI stage 3

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Grade C = Skin stage 3 or Liver stage 3 or GI stage 3
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Grade C severity is composed of three components: Skin stage 3 or Liver stage 3 or GI stage 3

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Grade B = Skin stage 2 or  Liver stage 1-2 or GI stage 1-2

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Grade B = Skin stage 2 or  Liver stage 1-2 or GI stage 1-2
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Grade B severity is composed of three components: Skin stage 2 or Liver stage 1-2 or GI stage 1-2.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Grade A = Skin stage 1, Liver stage 0, GI stage 0

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Grade A = Skin stage 1, Liver stage 0, GI stage 0
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Grade A severity is composed of three components: Skin stage 1, Liver stage 0, GI stage 0

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Severity Index Grade
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.:Index; a numerical scale used to compare variables with one another or with some reference number.:A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.
A numerical scale used to compare variables with one another or with some reference number; a number used to select an element of a list, vector, array or other sequence.
A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

ValueDomain.origin: IBCSG CRF:International Breast Cancer Study Group Case Report Form

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support NCI CCR trial.
